channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mandelson should no longer be a peer, says Starmer

item.title: Brown calls for inquiry into ‘shocking’ leak of government information by Mandelson to Epstein - UK politics live
item.description: Ex-PM has written to the Cabinet Office urging them to investigate his former friend over passing confidential memo to sex offender Peter Mandelson “l...

item.title: House attempts to advance funding bills to end partial government shutdown as battle over DHS spending continues – live
item.description: Speaker Mike Johnson faces narrow margins for House passage after Senate split off DHS funding amid backlash over fatal immigration enforcement shooti...

item.title: US envoy Steve Witkoff set to meet Netanyahu in Israel after Rafah border crossing to Gaza reopens – latest updates– latest updates

item.title: Current world order ‘dead’, Draghi warns Europe, as he outlines US and China threats – Europe live
item.description: Former Italian PM and ECB chief says Europe must urgently unify on defence and foreign affairs Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the country’s energy...

item.title: Fifa president Infantino apologises for jokes about British fans
item.description: Fifa president Gianni Infantino apologises for controversial comments he made about British football supporters which were criticised by fan groups.

item.title: Captain guilty of North Sea tanker crash death
item.description: Vladimir Motin is convicted of gross negligence manslaughter after a crew member died in the crash.

item.title: Steve Wright - the 'cruel' serial killer who hated women
item.description: Steve Wright's admission that he murdered Victoria Hall confirms he killed six women over a seven-year period.

item.title: Scottish government confirms it will not back prostitution offences bill
item.description: Independent MSP Ash Regan's bill would make it a criminal offence to pay for sex in Scotland.

item.title: Ukraine hails 'real results' after Musk restricts Russian Starlink use
item.description: Starlink-enabled drones have been linked to a number of recent deadly attacks by Russia on Ukraine.
